tasks.task: Using a Farm Tractor to Plow a Field
subtasks: Sit in the tractor's driver's seat
Engage the engine and start the tractor
Adjust the plow attachment to the desired depth
Drive the tractor forward, operating the steering to guide the plow
Monitor the plowing progress to ensure even coverage
Walk through the rows, inspecting plants for health or issues
Bend over to check specific plants or areas
Use tools or hands to adjust plants or soil as needed
Avoid obstacles or uneven terrain
Attach the cultivator to the tractor
Drive the tractor over the farmland, operating the cultivator to turn over soil
Adjust speed and depth settings as needed
Check for any mechanical issues during operation
Prepare the tools or equipment needed for hoeing
Manually adjust hoe depth into the soil
Push and pull the hoe to cut through weeds or plant barriers
Move to the next section, repeating the process
Load seeds into a seed drill or planter
Drive the equipment across the field, ensuring proper seed placement
Adjust settings for depth and spacing as necessary
Oversee the planting process to ensure accuracy
Prepare the pesticide and fill the sprayer tank
Secure the tractor attachment, calibrate the sprayer
Drive slowly through the field, controlling the sprayer to distribute pesticide evenly
Inspect the sprayer regularly to prevent leaks or malfunctions
Set up the harvester according to crop type
Operate the tractor pulling the harvester through the field
Monitor the harvesting process, ensuring efficient collection of crops
Adjust settings for optimal threshing and cleaning
Attach the mower to the tractor or ride-on mower
Drive the mower over the grass or hay, operating the height adjustment
Navigate around obstacles or designated areas
Collect the cut material if necessary, such as baling hay
Enter the livestock enclosure
Assess the animals' health and behavior
Inspect feeding areas and replenish feed as needed
Check water sources and distribute water
Prepare the feed according to the livestock's requirements
Distribute feed in designated areas or deliver directly to animals
Observe animals' eating habits and adjust distribution as necessary
Approach a cow to be milked
Clean the cow's udder thoroughly
Attach the milking machine or hand-milk
Monitor milk flow and quality
Remove the attachment and clean the area
Attach the implement to the tractor
Survey the field to determine the path
Drive the tractor at an appropriate speed, guiding the implement
Monitor the implement's performance and make adjustments
Check the tractor and attached equipment for signs of wear or damage
Lubricate or tighten components as needed
Test start-up procedures on machinery before operation
Slow down the tractor when approaching a turn or obstacle
Use foot brakes to stop the tractor safely
Shifting gears into park or neutral and applying the parking brake
Lower the implement or attaches, if any, to the ground or retain them safely
Remove debris from the interior and exterior of the tractor
Wash the cab with appropriate cleaning products and tools
Dry the cab and apply protective finishes if needed
Navigate the tractor or equipment on slopes
Use brakes or chocks to prevent movement while inspecting fields
Assess the field's condition carefully to avoid bumps

tasks.task: Feeding Equipment into a Forage Harvester
subtasks: Direct rows into the equipment's intake
Monitor the feed rate and adjust as necessary
Oversee the processing within the harvester
Set up the rotary cutter and processing unit
Drive the harvester through corn fields, bundling stalks into rows
Transport the corn to storage or processing areas
Position the mower in the starting position
Start the mower and engage the cutting mechanism
Drive the mower over the hay field, adjusting speed for optimal cut
Directly feed the hay into baling equipment if available
Inspect sprinkler heads or irrigation lines for leaks or damage
Fix leaks or replace damaged parts
Irrigate fields according to crop needs, adjusting the system timing
Monitor weather patterns to optimize water usage

tasks.task: Using a Drill to Plant Seeds
subtasks: Prepare the drill by selecting the appropriate seed and row spacing
Drive the drill over the prepared field, depositing seeds at the correct depth
Conduct a pass-by to ensure all rows are properly seeded
Check the residue from the drill for uniformity

tasks.task: Using a Disk Harrow to Prepare Soil
subtasks: Attach the disk harrow to the tractor
Drive the tractor slowly over the prepared field, operating the harrow
Adjust the depth of the disks as needed for soil preparation
Observe the soil's condition for proper aeration
Condition the hay to the proper moisture level
Operate the baler to collect and knot the hay into bales
Transport the bales to storage or handling areas
Check for any bale defects and rework as necessary
Seed the cover crop into existing soil using a broadcast spreader or drill
Adjust the spreader or planting depth according to the crop's requirements
Monitor planting progress and ensure even coverage
Assess the field for erosion risks
Choose appropriate measures, such as installing terraces or grass strips
Plant or establish the control measures
Monitor their establishment and maintenance
Inspect the tractor's tyres for wear, proper inflation
Inflate or deflate tyres as needed to maintain the recommended pressure
Tighten lug nuts or adjust wheel alignment if necessary
Position the rake behind the tractor
Adjust the rake's depth and speed settings
Drive the tractor and rake through the field, turning materials
Ensure the area is properly raked and prepared for planting or harvesting

tasks.task: Starting a Tractor for the First Time in the Season
subtasks: Check fluid levels and perform pre-start maintenance
Start the engine, check controls and gauges are functioning
Engage gears and test the turning capability
Adjust seat and mirrors for comfortable operation
Utilize a rope or line to define the field boundaries
Secure the markers at intervals to ensure proper definition
Adjust markings as the field is accessed for different operations
Load fertilizer into the spreader
Set the spread pattern and application rate
Drive the spreader across the field, adjusting spreader settings as necessary
Check for any clumping or uneven distribution
Attach any necessary landscaping equipment, like mowers or tillers
Navigate through the land, performing tasks such as mowing or tilling
Handle minor repairs or oiling to keep the four-wheeler running
